column1: Hasufel was the grey-coated steed of Gárulf of Rohan.  After the loss of his master in the Ambush at Fangorn Forest‎
column2: Hasufel followed the éored of Éomer until he lent it to Aragorn when they met in the northern fields of Rohan.

column1: The hardy creature saw many adventures
column2: including the Battle of the Hornburg
column3: before Aragorn was brought his own horse
column5: by the Rangers of the North.

column2: hasufel means "dark skin" in Old English.The Complete Guide to Middle-earth Hasu means "grey".
